executiveSummary: Entrepreneur Justin from Orange County, California, pitched his product 'Cup-A-Bug' on Shark Tank, seeking $50,000 for 10% equity. After demonstrating his humane bug-catching tool and sharing his passion for engineering and non-lethal pest control, Mark Cuban offered $75,000 for 20%, which Justin accepted, securing a long-term mentorship and investment partnership.
keyDecisions: Mark Cuban invested $75,000 for 20% equity in Cup-A-Bug.

actionItems.task: Collaborate with Mark Cuban on future product development and entrepreneurial projects.
Begin scaling Cup-A-Bug production and marketing with Mark Cuban’s guidance.

nextSteps: Justin will work closely with Mark Cuban to grow Cup-A-Bug, develop new product ideas, and expand his entrepreneurial ventures using Cuban’s resources and mentorship.
